title: "How can different psychological schools help satisfy human needs?"
first_phrase: In the previous paragraphs, the author explains the different schools of psychology they use to help people achieve their goals. They utilize behaviorism to develop new habits, cognitive psychology to change the way people perceive situations, somatic psychology to recognize the power of substances like water, breathing, and food to change physiology, and energy psychology to release trapped energy in the body. In this final section, the author lays out the Four Classes of Human Experiences and the Six Human Needs, which explains how people attempt to satisfy their needs in diverse ways. The author concludes by highlighting the importance of fulfilling the first human need - the need for security and comfort - and how it impacts our survival.

last_phrase: In conclusion, understanding how we satisfy our human needs can determine whether our actions and habits are constructive, destructive, or neutral. By identifying the different vehicles we use to meet our needs, such as control, consistency, and variety, we can make choices that not only benefit ourselves but also others and the greater good. So, let's strive to satisfy our human needs constructively and fulfill our need for certainty and variety in positive ways that promote personal growth and wellbeing.
